meanings.definition: A style of Latin music and dance originating in New York City in the 1960s.
meanings.sent1: At the dance competition, the performers showcased their best boogaloo moves.
meanings.sent2: The band played a catchy boogaloo tune that got everyone on their feet.
meanings.sent3: The family reunion turned into a boogaloo fest with music and dancing all night.
meanings.sent4: The boogaloo rhythm filled the room, making it impossible not to tap your feet.
meanings.sent5: The boogaloo beat was so infectious, even those who claimed they couldn't dance joined in.

meanings.definition: A lively and rhythmic dance performed to this style of music.
meanings.sent1: During the dance class, the instructor taught the students the classic boogaloo steps.
meanings.sent2: The crowd cheered as the dancers showcased their energetic boogaloo routine.
meanings.sent3: The wedding reception turned into a boogaloo dance-off between the bride and groom.
meanings.sent4: Her feet moved in perfect harmony with the boogaloo music, mesmerizing everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The boogaloo dance competition was fierce, with each participant bringing their unique style to the floor.

meanings.definition: A lively and spirited party or celebration.
meanings.sent1: The neighborhood block party was a true boogaloo with music, food, and laughter.
meanings.sent2: Everyone had a blast at the boogaloo thrown by the local community center.
meanings.sent3: The office holiday party turned into a boogaloo with colleagues dancing and having fun.
meanings.sent4: The boogaloo celebration lasted until the early hours of the morning, with no one wanting to leave.
meanings.sent5: The town's annual boogaloo festival brought people together for a day of joy and festivity.
